faq.question: What versions of Java does Celtix support?
Does Celtix support development languages other than Java?
faq.answer: Yes. Celtix supports the development of services using Javascript and E4X.

faq.question: Does Celtix provide any tools to assist in developing applications with Celtix?

answer.p: Celtix includes a number of command-line based tools for generating the artifacts needed to develop applications with Celtix. These include:

ul.li: wsdl2java for generating Java code from a service contract.
java2wsdl for generating a service contract from a Java class.
xsd2wsdl for generating a service contract from an XMLSchema document.

answer.p: In addition there are a number of command lines tools for manipulating service contracts.

faq.question: Are there any GUI tools for working with Celtix?
faq.answer: No. Celtix is working with the STP project at the Eclipse project to develop GUI based tools for working with SOAs.

faq.question: Does Celtix provide any orchestration features?
faq.answer: No. However, Celtix services can be orchestrated using a number of BPEL engines. There is a demo illustrating Celtix working with Intalio's BPEL offering on the demo page at demos page.
